The statement to be proved inductively

{F : Type u_1} ‚Üí
  [inst : Field F] ‚Üí {E : Type u_2} ‚Üí [inst_1 : Field E] ‚Üí [inst_2 : Algebra F E] ‚Üí ‚Ü•(solvableByRad F E) ‚Üí Prop

The theorem states that to prove a property for all families of finite sets, it suffices to verify it for the empty family, the family consisting only of the empty set, and show that if the property holds for families without a specific element and with that element in every set, then it holds for their union.

type:
‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} [inst : DecidableEq Œ±] {p : Finset (Finset Œ±) ‚Üí Prop} (ùíú : Finset (Finset Œ±)),
  p ‚àÖ ‚Üí
    p {‚àÖ} ‚Üí
      (‚àÄ (a : Œ±) ‚¶Éùíú : Finset (Finset Œ±)‚¶Ñ, (‚àÄ s ‚àà ùíú, a ‚àâ s) ‚Üí p ùíú ‚Üí p (Finset.image (insert a) ùíú)) ‚Üí
        (‚àÄ (a : Œ±) ‚¶Éùíú : Finset (Finset Œ±)‚¶Ñ,
            p (Finset.filter (fun x => a ‚àâ x) ùíú) ‚Üí p (Finset.filter (fun x => a ‚àà x) ùíú) ‚Üí p ùíú) ‚Üí
          p ùíú
name: Finset.family_induction_on
docString: The theorem states that to prove a property for all families of finite sets, it suffices to verify it for the empty family, the family consisting only of the empty set, and show that if the property holds for families without a specific element and with that element in every set, then it holds for their union.

This theorem states that, for any two propositions `a` and `b`, the existence of a proof of `b` given a proof of `a` is equivalent to the conjunction of `a` and `b`. In other words, there exists a proof of `b` under the assumption that `a` is true if and only if both `a` and `b` are true.

type: ‚àÄ {Œ± : Sort u_1} {p : Œ± ‚Üí Prop}, (¬¨‚àÄ (x : Œ±), p x) = ‚àÉ x, ¬¨p x
name: Mathlib.Data.Finset.Basic._auxLemma.144
docString: This theorem states that, for any two propositions `a` and `b`, the existence of a proof of `b` given a proof of `a` is equivalent to the conjunction of `a` and `b`. In other words, there exists a proof of `b` under the assumption that `a` is true if and only if both `a` and `b` are true.

(Impl) Show that the raised cone is a limit.

type:
{J : Type v} ‚Üí
  [inst : CategoryTheory.SmallCategory J] ‚Üí
    {C : Type u} ‚Üí
      [inst_1 : CategoryTheory.Category.{v, u} C] ‚Üí
        [inst_2 : CategoryTheory.IsConnected J] ‚Üí
          {B : C} ‚Üí
            {F : CategoryTheory.Functor J (CategoryTheory.Over B)} ‚Üí
              {c : CategoryTheory.Limits.Cone (CategoryTheory.Functor.comp F (CategoryTheory.Over.forget B))} ‚Üí
                CategoryTheory.Limits.IsLimit c ‚Üí
                  CategoryTheory.Limits.IsLimit (CategoryTheory.Over.CreatesConnected.raiseCone c)
name: CategoryTheory.Over.CreatesConnected.raisedConeIsLimit
docString: (Impl) Show that the raised cone is a limit.

The theorem states that to prove a statement for every family of finite sets, it suffices to verify it for the empty family, the family containing only the empty set, and the family obtained by adding an element to a family, under the assumption that the statement holds for the subfamilies of sets not containing that element.

type:
‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} [inst : DecidableEq Œ±] {p : Finset (Finset Œ±) ‚Üí Prop} (ùíú : Finset (Finset Œ±)),
  p ‚àÖ ‚Üí
    p {‚àÖ} ‚Üí
      (‚àÄ (a : Œ±) ‚¶Éùíú : Finset (Finset Œ±)‚¶Ñ, p (Finset.nonMemberSubfamily a ùíú) ‚Üí p (Finset.memberSubfamily a ùíú) ‚Üí p ùíú) ‚Üí
        p ùíú
name: Finset.memberFamily_induction_on
docString: The theorem states that to prove a statement for every family of finite sets, it suffices to verify it for the empty family, the family containing only the empty set, and the family obtained by adding an element to a family, under the assumption that the statement holds for the subfamilies of sets not containing that element.

This theorem from Measure Theory in Mathlib (a library for the Lean Theorem Prover) states that for any two propositions `a` and `b`, the statement "there exists an instance where `a` is true such that `b` is also true" is equivalent to the statement "`a` is true and `b` is true". This establishes an equivalence between two different ways of expressing a joint assertion in logic.

type: ‚àÄ {b a : Prop}, (‚àÉ (_ : a), b) = (a ‚àß b)
name: Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Measure.Lebesgue.Basic._auxLemma.10
docString: This theorem from Measure Theory in Mathlib (a library for the Lean Theorem Prover) states that for any two propositions `a` and `b`, the statement "there exists an instance where `a` is true such that `b` is also true" is equivalent to the statement "`a` is true and `b` is true". This establishes an equivalence between two different ways of expressing a joint assertion in logic.

type:
{C : Type u‚ÇÅ} ‚Üí
  [inst : CategoryTheory.Category.{v‚ÇÅ, u‚ÇÅ} C] ‚Üí

              (t : CategoryTheory.Limits.IsColimit c) ‚Üí
                [inst_2 :
                    CategoryTheory.Limits.PreservesColimit
                      (CategoryTheory.Functor.comp D (CategoryTheory.Monad.forget T)) T.toFunctor] ‚Üí
                  [inst_3 :
                      CategoryTheory.Limits.PreservesColimit
                        (CategoryTheory.Functor.comp (CategoryTheory.Functor.comp D (CategoryTheory.Monad.forget T))
                          T.toFunctor)
                        T.toFunctor] ‚Üí
                    CategoryTheory.Limits.IsColimit (CategoryTheory.Monad.ForgetCreatesColimits.liftedCocone c t)
name: CategoryTheory.Monad.ForgetCreatesColimits.liftedCoconeIsColimit
docString: (Impl) Prove that the lifted cocone is colimiting.

A convenient way to show that a binary cofan is a colimit.

type:
{C : Type u} ‚Üí
  [inst : CategoryTheory.Category.{v, u} C] ‚Üí
    {X Y : C} ‚Üí
      (s : CategoryTheory.Limits.BinaryCofan X Y) ‚Üí
        (desc : {T : C} ‚Üí (X ‚ü∂ T) ‚Üí (Y ‚ü∂ T) ‚Üí (s.pt ‚ü∂ T)) ‚Üí
          (‚àÄ {T : C} (f : X ‚ü∂ T) (g : Y ‚ü∂ T),
              CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp (CategoryTheory.Limits.BinaryCofan.inl s) (desc f g) = f) ‚Üí
            (‚àÄ {T : C} (f : X ‚ü∂ T) (g : Y ‚ü∂ T),
                CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp (CategoryTheory.Limits.BinaryCofan.inr s) (desc f g) = g) ‚Üí
              (‚àÄ {T : C} (f : X ‚ü∂ T) (g : Y ‚ü∂ T) (m : s.pt ‚ü∂ T),
                  CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp (CategoryTheory.Limits.BinaryCofan.inl s) m = f ‚Üí
                    CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp (CategoryTheory.Limits.BinaryCofan.inr s) m = g ‚Üí m = desc f g) ‚Üí
                CategoryTheory.Limits.IsColimit s
name: CategoryTheory.Limits.BinaryCofan.IsColimit.mk
docString: A convenient way to show that a binary cofan is a colimit.
